content.description: It's cleaned up over time and has become a worthy line. Direct start out the right side of the cave makes it 10a
content.location: Original start is to the right of the big roof. A new direct start leaves the right side of big roof and gets into the crack system sooner.

content.description: Fun. Possible to access belay by traversing in from Deodate. Exit upper dihedral to left.
content.location: Starts off the anchors for Eschaton/Opiate

content.description:
On the left side of the face, climb a 5.10b finger crack to a belay with a bolt.

Continue up 5.10a hands and a loose section to a belay.

A 5.9 chimney squeezes down to 5.10a offwidth. Belay at the top.

Climb class 4 to the summit.
Goes up broken corner to roof. Tricky sequence over roof gets you to good climbing in dihedral.
content.location: Starts 15 feet right of big roof. Same start as Deodate.

content.description: This route starts with the first bolt of Gorilla Cookies then moves left clipping another independent bolt out left to gain a broken corner system.   Tricky but good gear gets one to the first left trending roof.   Get through this until the next left trending roof is reached.   At this point, as things get increasingly hard, reach right and clip a bolt then proceed around into the overhanging crack with great gear.   Pump your way to an awkward yet viable stance in a shallow left facing corner.   Clip a bolt out right and maneuver around that way using arête and face holds while gunning towards the anchor for Gorilla Cookies.  There is a really good offset cam before the last steep moves to the anchor.   Deceivingly steep and pumpy.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a some gear.   We had a blue totem, 2 green aliens, a yellow alien, a .75 camalot, a purple C3, and an offset X4 red/yellow 0.1-0.2.
content.location: Start as for Gorilla Cookies then head left after first bolt......
Start at base of steep section, go out right side of roof and up.

content.description: This is a nice sport climb to the left of Gorilla Cookies. The crux is a bit of pumpy liebacks and underclings through the roofs and overhangs about 30ft up. Finish up and left across big knobs. A 2 bolt anchor/rap is above a small shelf on the arete.

Not a bad little sport climb.  Sustained 5.9 and 5.10a moves on great edges.  The crux is pulling the mantle at the top and clipping the chains.

Start by clipping an off route bolt just uphill of the climb.  This will protect the leader from tumbling downhill if a fall occurs before the first bolt is clipped.  After that its all about finding the rests and reading the moves.
content.protection: Nine quickdraws - Eight for the climb and one more for the start.  Rappel from chains with one 60m rope.
content.location: This climb is to the right and up from the Sermon.  Follow the base uphill until you reach a couple of platforms with sport climbs.  Gorilla Cookies is the higher up of the two.

content.description: Easier moves down low lead to cruxes up high. A little grainy but will hopefully clean up with more traffic
content.location: Start by a bay tree on the left side of the roofs at the base of the Pulpit’s northwest face.  It joins up with Opiate for the last few bolts.

content.description: The link-up of the first pitch of Deodate and Buying New Soul. An epic 180' pitch of great mid-5.11 climbing.
content.protection: Mostly bolts (20+) and a single rack.
content.location: Start on Deodate and then head up and right onto Buying New Soul.

content.description: 1st pitch- Same start as Pulp What? but steps left at roof into shallow dihedral. Near top of dihedral goes left again to anchors. If doing second pitch continue traversing left above big roof to 2-bolt belay (better stance). 2nd pitch-Wanders up past gear and bolts to anchor left of small bay tree.
content.location: Starts about 15 feet right of big roofs. Same start as Pulp What?

content.description: Goes right from the 1st pitch anchors of Deodate.
content.protection: 13 bolts. Optional gear .5-2” for the top.
